sentence.Network_en: Parisians on the street often looked worried, hurried and unfriendly.
sentence.Network_cn: 巴黎街上的路人往往看上去忧心忡忡、匆匆忙忙而且不太友善。

sentence.Network_en: Pubs are dirty, smelly and unfriendly, according to the Good Pub Guide.
sentence.Network_cn: 据《好酒吧指南》所说，酒吧一般环境肮脏，气味难闻，而且气氛很不友好。

sentence.Network_en: Judy spoke in a loud, rather unfriendly voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 朱迪说话时声音很大，十分不友好。

entry.tran: 不友好的；不友善的；有敌意的
entry.def: If you describe a person, organization, or their behaviour as unfriendly, you mean that they behave towards you in an unkind or rather hostile way.

example.ex: It is not fair for him to be permanently unfriendly to someone who has hurt him...
example.tran: 他对伤害过自己的人永远存有敌意，这样是不对的。

example.ex: People always complain that the big banks and big companies are unfriendly and unhelpful...
example.tran: 人们总是抱怨大银行和大公司不友善、不愿提供帮助。

means.word_mean: 1. not easy to understand or use;
2. not disposed to friendship or friendliness;
5. very unfavorable to life or growth;

auth_sentence.content: Ion batteries are so last century and so unfriendly.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ion batteries are so last century and so unfriendly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ion batteries are so last century and so unfriendly.

auth_sentence.content: You are now depending on oil from unfriendly nations.
auth_sentence.res_content: You are now depending on oil from unfriendly nations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You are now depending on oil from unfriendly nations.

auth_sentence.content: This customer-unfriendly system is made worse with mobile phones.
auth_sentence.res_content: This customer-unfriendly system is made worse with mobile phones.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This customer-unfriendly system is made worse with mobile phones.

means.word_mean: 不友好的;有敌意的;冷漠的

sentences.en: Our neighbours are unfriendly to us.
sentences.cn: 我们的邻居对我们不友好。
